articles.author: KSP Indonesia
articles.title: Update KSP Januari 25 Pencairan Rp1,000,000
articles.description: Rencana Pengunaan Dana: 4 representatives of Team 7 of the Komodo Lizard Division formed by the Komodo National Park and intensively trained from the Komodo Survival Program (KSP) had the opportunity to have an audience with the Director-General of Natural Resources and Ecosystem Conservation. On this occasion, representatives of Team 7 of the Komodo Lizard Division gave a presentation to the Director-General of KSDAE regarding the objectives of the formation of Team 7 of the Komodo Lizard Division.

articles.author: KSP Indonesia
articles.title: Update KSP Januari 25 Pencairan Rp1,000,000
articles.description: Rencana Pengunaan Dana: Support local community patrols, increasing the capacity of management staff through trainings and raising public awareness and education in schools, both in the Komodo National Park

articles.author: KSP Indonesia
articles.title: Update KSP December 27 Pencairan Rp1,000,000
articles.description: Dana akan dilanjutkan untuk membeli alat alat untuk monitor komodo di area.

articles.author: Josh Lederman
articles.title: Update KSP November 10 Pencairan RP 200,000
articles.description: Rencana Penggunaan Dana Pencairan : Funds used to help publish a new publication about ecology. A study by Komodo Survival Program, in collaboration with Komodo National Park, is recently published in Ecology. This study evaluated whether predation by the Komodo dragon, the world’s largest lizard, regulates populations of its two key large mammalian prey species. We also compared biomass density and population energy use of Komodo dragons with other apex mammalian predators. We need 18 years of research to get and publish this finding.

articles.author: Josh Lederman
articles.title: Update KSP November 10 Pencairan RP 200,000
articles.description: Komodo dragon population monitoring program at Torong Padang, North Flores
